thread.title: The H.S. cross-country report: Around the course for Oct. 16 - Sports
thread.title_full: The H.S. cross-country report: Around the course for Oct. 16 - Sports - NorthJersey.com

author: PAUL SCHWARTZ
title: The H.S. cross-country report: Around the course for Oct. 16 - Sports
text:
-- Even though Dwight-Englewood won the NJIC Meadowlands boys championship last Monday, it hasn’t been an easy year for the Bulldogs and rookie head coach Dan Sussman.
“It’s hard not being having coach Kraut [longtime head coach Jerry Krauthamer] around this year,” said Sussman, the former assistant who succeeded Krauthamer when he retired due to ill health. “This gives the season and the victory more meaning.”
“It’s incredible,” said junior Zane Diaz, the last tie to the 2013 and 2014 divisional champions. “Going into this year we knew that we had to replace a lot of great runners and we got lucky with two gifted and talented freshmen [David Khym and Jeremy Bronstein] who joined the team this year.”
-- Speaking of talented freshmen, there’s none more talented than Kennedy ’s Jaron Jordan. The freshman won the Big North Liberty championship with his third race of less than 17 minutes this year at Garret Mountain, the first time any Passaic County freshman has done that. It puts him in line to become the first freshman boy to win the Passaic County title Oct. 23.
“I know I can run faster,” said Jordan, who ran 16:48 at the Liberty meet, 12 seconds faster than Wayne Hills senior George Galkin ran in winning the Independence meet on the same day. “I did what I needed to do today but I have a goal of 16:20 this year.”
Galkin has run 16:43 this year at Garret.
-- The division of non-public schools from public schools in the Bergen County Cross-Country championships was made complete when the Bergen County Women’s Coaches Association approved the proposal several weeks ago. That puts Dwight-Englewood, Saddle River Day and St. Mary’s into the same division as Don Bosco, Bergen Catholic, IHA and Holy Angels in the meet Oct. 24. The BCWCA has promised to revisit the issue after the Lou Molino Memorial Meet of Champions.
-- Qualifiers for the Meet of Champions will be the top two teams and 10 individuals from each of the five groups, along with three team wild cards based on total team time and 10 wild card individuals who do not otherwise qualify.
